Granting Server-Level Access Rights

At the server level, access rights authorize users and groups to perform application operations in a specific server configuration. By default, the Administrators group is assigned all project and server rights, and the All Users group has the right to create projects, as well as to review the server configuration and the server log.

Note: You can perform this function only on servers that are currently running.

To set Server access rights:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server.

    • From the client, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name > Server Administration (available with custom installations only).

    The Server Administration dialog appears.  

  2. Select a server configuration from the left pane. If you have not yet logged on, you will be asked to do so. If you are using the client, you can administer remote servers only.

  3. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

    • Click the Accounts bar in the lower left panel. Then click the Access Rights shortcut.

    • From the menu, select Tools > Accounts > Access Rights.

      • These actions display the Access Rights dialog.

  4. Click New. The Add a User or Group dialog appears.

  5. Select the user or group to be assigned access rights from the list. Groups and users are listed alphabetically, with a (G) after group names.

  6. Select the Grant option button. Never select Deny unless you are creating an exception.

  7. Click OK to add the group or user and return to the Access Rights dialog.

  8. On the Access Rights dialog, select and/or clear the appropriate check boxes.

  9. Click OK when you are done.

 

Server Access Rights

View server log

Review, but not change, server log information.

View statistics and licensing information

Review, but not change, statistics information (in StarTeam Server 5.4 and earlier releases). Review licensing information and create license usage files.

View system configuration

Review, but not change, the server configuration options.

Modify system configuration

Change server configuration options.

Remotely administer server

Do any of the following:

  • Lock/unlock the server.

  • Restart the server from the client.

  • Shut down the server from the client.

  • Allows user to access the Start/Stop Conversion and Hive Manager vault buttons.

Administer user accounts

Add groups and users.

View system policy

Review, but not change, the password and log-on failure options for the server configuration.

Modify system policy

Change the password and log-on failure options for the server configuration.

Change server access rights

Set Server access rights. If you change this setting, be sure that your name is still listed as one of the users who can change access rights.

View security log

View the security log, which lists security events, such as logging on and off.

StarDisk: Create new users

Add users to the Collaboration Users group. This right allows StarDisk users to share folders with people who are not currently listed as users in the server. The Collaboration Users group should be given only minimal rights and privileges.

Replication support: Change user/operation time

Replicate user names and creation times.

Project operations: Create projects

Create projects when the server is running this server configuration.

Customizations: Modify database schema

Add customized fields as item properties, or modify any field for an item that is modifiable.

Component operations: Administer component-level access rights

Designate team members who can create and change component-level access rights.
